trans-unit.source: Backs up a file or directory, including the security information

seg-source.mrk: Backs up a file or directory, including the security information

target.mrk: Backs up a file or directory, including the security information

trans-unit.source: Parameters

seg-source.mrk: Parameters

target.mrk: Parameters

trans-unit.source: Handle to the file or directory to be backed up.

seg-source.mrk: Handle to the file or directory to be backed up.

target.mrk: Handle to the file or directory to be backed up.

trans-unit.source: To obtain the handle, call the _WinAPI_CreateFileEx() function.

seg-source.mrk: To obtain the handle, call the _WinAPI_CreateFileEx() function.

target.mrk: To obtain the handle, call the _WinAPI_CreateFileEx() function.

trans-unit.source: The SACLs are not read unless the file handle was created with the $ACCESS_SYSTEM_SECURITY access right.

seg-source.mrk: The SACLs are not read unless the file handle was created with the $ACCESS_SYSTEM_SECURITY access right.

target.mrk: The SACLs are not read unless the file handle was created with the $ACCESS_SYSTEM_SECURITY access right.

trans-unit.source: A pointer to a buffer that receives the data.

seg-source.mrk: A pointer to a buffer that receives the data.

target.mrk: A pointer to a buffer that receives the data.

trans-unit.source: The size of the buffer, in bytes.

seg-source.mrk: The size of the buffer, in bytes.

target.mrk: The size of the buffer, in bytes.

trans-unit.source: The buffer size must be greater than the size of the $tagWIN32_STREAM_ID structure.

seg-source.mrk: The buffer size must be greater than the size of the $tagWIN32_STREAM_ID structure.

target.mrk: The buffer size must be greater than the size of the $tagWIN32_STREAM_ID structure.

trans-unit.source: (see also MSDN for more information)

seg-source.mrk: (see also MSDN for more information)

target.mrk: (see also MSDN for more information)

trans-unit.source: The number of bytes read.

seg-source.mrk: The number of bytes read.

target.mrk: The number of bytes read.

trans-unit.source: A pointer to an internal data structure used by this function to maintain context information during a backup operation.

seg-source.mrk: A pointer to an internal data structure used by this function to maintain context information during a backup operation.

target.mrk: A pointer to an internal data structure used by this function to maintain context information during a backup operation.

trans-unit.source: You must set this variable to 0 before the first call to _WinAPI_BackupRead() for the specified file or directory.

seg-source.mrk: You must set this variable to 0 before the first call to _WinAPI_BackupRead() for the specified file or directory.

target.mrk: You must set this variable to 0 before the first call to _WinAPI_BackupRead() for the specified file or directory.

trans-unit.source: The function allocates memory for the data structure, and then sets the variable to point to that structure.

seg-source.mrk: The function allocates memory for the data structure, and then sets the variable to point to that structure.

target.mrk: The function allocates memory for the data structure, and then sets the variable to point to that structure.

trans-unit.source: You must not change this variable or the variable that it points to between calls to _WinAPI_BackupRead().

seg-source.mrk: You must not change this variable or the variable that it points to between calls to _WinAPI_BackupRead().

target.mrk: You must not change this variable or the variable that it points to between calls to _WinAPI_BackupRead().

trans-unit.source: [optional] Specifies whether the function will backup the access-control list (ACL) data, valid values:

seg-source.mrk: [optional]
Specifies whether the function will backup the access-control list (ACL) data, valid values:

target.mrk: [optional]
Specifies whether the function will backup the access-control list (ACL) data, valid values:

trans-unit.source: True - The ACL data will be backed up.

seg-source.mrk: True - The ACL data will be backed up.

target.mrk: True - The ACL data will be backed up.

trans-unit.source: False - The ACL data will be omitted (Default).

seg-source.mrk: False - The ACL data will be omitted (Default).

target.mrk: False - The ACL data will be omitted (Default).

trans-unit.source: Return Value

seg-source.mrk: Return Value

target.mrk: Return Value

trans-unit.source: True.

seg-source.mrk: True.

target.mrk: True.

trans-unit.source: False, call _WinAPI_GetLastError() to get extended error information.

seg-source.mrk: False, call _WinAPI_GetLastError() to get extended error information.

target.mrk: False, call _WinAPI_GetLastError() to get extended error information.

trans-unit.source: Remarks

seg-source.mrk: Remarks

target.mrk: Remarks

trans-unit.source: The _WinAPI_BackupRead() is not intended for use in backing up files encrypted under the Encrypted File System (EFS).

seg-source.mrk: The _WinAPI_BackupRead() is not intended for use in backing up files encrypted under the Encrypted File System (EFS).

target.mrk: The _WinAPI_BackupRead() is not intended for use in backing up files encrypted under the Encrypted File System (EFS).

trans-unit.source: If an error occurs during the data reading, the calling process can skip the bad data by calling the _WinAPI_BackupSeek() function.

seg-source.mrk: If an error occurs during the data reading, the calling process can skip the bad data by calling the _WinAPI_BackupSeek() function.

target.mrk: If an error occurs during the data reading, the calling process can skip the bad data by calling the _WinAPI_BackupSeek() function.

trans-unit.source: When you are done using _WinAPI_BackupRead(), you must call _WinAPI_BackupReadAbort() function with the appropriate parameter to release the memory used by the internal data structure.

seg-source.mrk: When you are done using _WinAPI_BackupRead(), you must call _WinAPI_BackupReadAbort() function with the appropriate parameter to release the memory used by the internal data structure.

target.mrk: When you are done using _WinAPI_BackupRead(), you must call _WinAPI_BackupReadAbort() function with the appropriate parameter to release the memory used by the internal data structure.

trans-unit.source: The file or directory should be restored using the _WinAPI_BackupWrite() function.

seg-source.mrk: The file or directory should be restored using the _WinAPI_BackupWrite() function.

target.mrk: The file or directory should be restored using the _WinAPI_BackupWrite() function.
